results.title: Yum yum noodles
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, Troy Innocent, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Time for a bowl of something hot, wet and instant - Yum Yum noodles. Buy some today! MSG added for good tasty flavour. A parody of a noodle advertisment that comments on stereotypes of Asian cultures.

results.title: History & styles of rock music in Australia
results.creator_credit: Euan Mitchell, Sylvie Leber, John Foss, Australian Contemporary Music Development Co (AUSMUSIC) and Serious Business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic music industry skills”.
Introduction to the Music Industry. Module 4.1. A fascinating look at the development of Australian rock music from its humble beginnings during Johnny O’Keefe’s “Wild One” days in the mid 1950’s, the struggles to gain recognition at home and overseas in the ‘60’s and ‘70’s to the international success of Australian acts in the ‘80’s and the diversity of styles in the ‘90’s. Through personal accounts, photographs and music video clips we examine, decade by decade, the music styles, fashions, changing technology and trends in Australian rock music including legendary performers such as The Easybeats, Russell Morris, AC/DC, Skyhooks, Cold Chisel and Midnight Oil.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Euan Mitchell, Sylvie Leber, John Foss, Australian Contemporary Music Development Co (AUSMUSIC) and Serious Business

results.title: Basic music industry skills
results.brief_description: Basic Music Industry Skills is an accredited Certificate Level Course suitable for use across the Years 9 to 12 curriculum. It is divided into modules focusing on different aspects of the music industry. Geared specifically to a teenage audience, it is nevertheless both informative and entertaining.

results.title: Making a music video on the cheap: from concept to completion
results.creator_credit: Greg Ferguson, AUSMUSIC and Conspiracy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic music industry skills”.
Module 21.2. This program demonstrates how a broadcast quality music video can be made for around $1,000. Shows the operation of a video camera and techniques such as white balance. Australian band Pelican Jed, take the viewer through a step by step analysis of their latest music video, highlighting the roles played by each member of the production team including interviews with the producer and director. The emphasis is to take the viewer from the concept stage to completion; where an idea becomes a reality.

results.title: Sitting right
results.brief_description: Opening with a series of incidents in which girls are rebuked for poor posture, the film presents examples of good habits which are juxtaposed against bad ones. The film suggests that women can improve their posture by observing movie stars and other well poised role models. Stresses the importance of maintaining a healthy mental attitude to appearance, by devoting regular time to practicing good posture, until it become effortless and automatic. Shows how to sit down and how to stand up with particular attention to leg, arm and head positions. An essential guide for any women, or man, aspiring to ladylike poise and grace.

results.title: Nevil the ninja
results.creator_credit: Grant Noble, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: It’s show and tell day at school and a young girl recites a poem in front of the whole class recounting the exploits of Nevil Ninja, master of the ancient and dubious art of Ninjutsu and the story of his defeat against a very little girl.

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 1
results.creator_credit: John Hooper, Nicholas Rossiter and BBC
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this first part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits galleries in Liverpool, Cambridge and Oxford, stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Sixteen days in September
results.brief_description: The September 2000 Olympic Games held in Sydney, Australia has been hailed as the Games that restored people’s faith in the Olympic movement. With a global participation of 11,000 athletes from 200 nations, this commemorative program captures all the greatest achievements and performances of Australia’s most successful Olympic team ever and shows all of their medal-winning performances, whether Gold, Silver or Bronze.

results.title: Sirius puppy training with Dr. Ian Dunbar
results.creator_credit: Beth M Toth, Martin Bluford and Bluford-Toth Productions
results.brief_description: This video is the first comprehensive obedience, behaviour and temperament training program designed especially for puppies. Emphasising family participation, this video shows owners how to teach their puppy basic obedience commands such as “come”, “sit”, “heel”, and “stay”. Through daily handling and calming exercises, your puppy can also be taught to overcome biting, barking, and housetraining behavioural problems. The aim of the video is to train dogs to be good companions and a joy to live with.
